metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9576 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The blk_rq_map_user_iov function in block/blk-map.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.8.14 does not properly restrict the type of iterator, which allowslocal users to read or write to arbitrary kernel memory locations or causea denial of service (use-after-free) by leveraging access to a /dev/sgdevice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-62.83
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1042.49
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1046-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1046.50
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1003.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-62.83').
